title: PristineSeasR2
text: PristineSeasR2 provides toolkit marine scientists researchers working Pristine Seas data. package streamlines analytical workflows ensuring visual consistency data standardization across projects.

title: PristineSeasR2
text: can install development version PristineSeasR2 GitHub :

title: PristineSeasR2
code: library(PristineSeasR2)  paths <- get_drive_paths()  paths$expeditions |>    list.dirs(recursive = FALSE, full.names = FALSE)

what: PristineSeasR2: Tools for Pristine Seas Scientific Data Analysis and Visualization — PristineSeasR2-package
title: PristineSeasR2: Tools for Pristine Seas Scientific Data Analysis and Visualization — PristineSeasR2-package
text: Provides helper functions analyzing Pristine Seas scientific data, custom color palettes themes data visualization, standardized vocabularies consistent data analysis across expeditions. Designed internal use Pristine Seas research team enhance workflow efficiency maintain analytical consistency.

title: PristineSeasR2: Tools for Pristine Seas Scientific Data Analysis and Visualization — PristineSeasR2-package
text: Maintainer: Juan Mayorga marine.data.science@ngs.org

title: Allowed Vocabularies — allowed_vocab
text: Standardized vocabularies Pristine Seas data collection analysis.

title: Allowed Vocabularies — allowed_vocab
Allowed Vocabularies — allowed_vocab
text: named list containing vocabulary vectors different data fields

title: Allowed Vocabularies — allowed_vocab
text: trophic_group - Fish trophic classifications: shark — sharks top_predator — Large predatory fish excluding sharks lower_carnivore — Mid-level carnivorous fish herbivore_detritivore — Plant detritus feeding fish planktivore — Plankton feeding fish depth_strata - Survey depth categories: supershallow — 0.1 - 6m depth shallow — 6.1 - 14m depth deep — 14.1 - 30m depth exposure - Site exposure conditions: windward — Exposed prevailing swell wind; typically high wave energy surge leeward — Sheltered side reef island protected prevailing swell lagoon — Located inside reef atoll, generally protected direct wave action channel — Within reef pass surge channel; often features strong tidal currents sheltered — Protected wave energy bay geomorphic feature exposed — Generally high energy due wave swell exposure; used windward/leeward apply unknown — Exposure determined insufficient data classify uvs_habitats - UVS habitat classifications: fore_reef — Seaward-facing outer slope coral reef back_reef — Lagoon-facing side behind reef crest reef_flat — Horizontal shallow zone near crest patch_reef — Isolated reef outcrop within lagoon sand plain pinnacle_reef — Steep-sided, often isolated coral structures bank — Flat-topped offshore feature reef rocky habitat rocky_reef — Non-coral reef formed rock, reef biota reef_pavement — Flat, low-relief hard-bottom reef surface channel_pass — Channel reef system strong flow wall — Vertical steep reef drop-kelp_forest — Dense canopy-forming macroalgae habitat seagrass — Dominant seagrass bed habitat functional_groups - Benthic functional group classifications: hard_coral — Hard coral colonies structures cca — Crustose coralline algae cyanobacteria — Cyanobacterial mats films soft_coral — Soft coral colonies sea fans sponges — Sponge communities structures erect_algae — Erect/branching macroalgae encrusting_algae — Encrusting algal forms turf — Algal turf matrices sediment_rubble_barren — Sediment, rubble, barren substrate — functional groups classified

what: Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
title: Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
text: Creates comprehensive standardized folder structure Pristine Seas expeditions expeditions folder science drive. Expedition names follow convention ISO3-YEAR (e.g., CHL-2024).

title: Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
text: expedition_name Character string. Name expedition following ISO3-YEAR format create_readme Logical. Whether create README.md file expedition template (default: TRUE)

title: Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
text: Character string. Path created expedition folder

title: Create New Pristine Seas Expedition Structure — create_expedition
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create an expedition (standard naming: ISO3-YEAR) create_expedition("CHL-2024")  # Create expedition without README create_expedition("MEX-2024", create_readme = FALSE) } # }

title: Create Expedition README Template — create_expedition_readme
text: Create Expedition README Template

title: Create Expedition README Template — create_expedition_readme

what: Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
title: Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
text: Creates simple standardized folder structure Pristine Seas projects projects folder science drive.

title: Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
text: project_name Character string. Name new project (use "prj-" prefix convention)

title: Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
text: Character string. Path created project folder

title: Create New Pristine Seas Project Structure — create_project
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a project create_project("prj-coral-reef-assessment")  # Create another project create_project("prj-fish-surveys") } # }

what: Get Standardized Paths for the Science Team in Google Drive — get_drive_paths
title: Get Standardized Paths for the Science Team in Google Drive — get_drive_paths
text: function returns correct file path "SCIENCE" folder within "Pristine Seas" Google Drive Desktop, ensuring compatibility across Mac Windows. automatically searches ngs.org Google Drive account first, default another account needed.

title: Get Standardized Paths for the Science Team in Google Drive — get_drive_paths
Get Standardized Paths for the Science Team in Google Drive — get_drive_paths
text: named list full paths "SCIENCE", "datasets", "expeditions", "projects".

title: Get Standardized Paths for the Science Team in Google Drive — get_drive_paths
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get paths for the SCIENCE folder and subfolders paths <- get_drive_paths() print(paths$science)      # Path to SCIENCE folder print(paths$datasets)     # Path to datasets folder print(paths$expeditions)  # Path to expeditions folder print(paths$projects)     # Path to projects folder } # }

title: Get Pristine Seas Colors — ps_colors
text: Get Pristine Seas Colors

title: Get Pristine Seas Colors — ps_colors
Get Pristine Seas Colors — ps_colors
text: palette Character. Palette name

title: Get Pristine Seas Colors — ps_colors
text: Named vector hex color codes

title: Get Pristine Seas Colors — ps_colors
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ps_colors("trophic_group") ps_colors("functional_groups")  # Use in ggplot2 scale_color_manual(values = ps_colors("trophic_group")) } # }

title: Scientists Lookup Table — ps_researchers
text: Directory Pristine Seas scientists collaborators contact information, affiliations, research specialties.

title: Scientists Lookup Table — ps_researchers
Scientists Lookup Table — ps_researchers
text: data frame scientist information

title: Scientists Lookup Table — ps_researchers
text: status categories: core — Full-time Pristine Seas staff affiliate — Regular collaborators partners visiting — Visiting scientists temporary collaborators Emeritus - Retired team member Local - Local participant

what: Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
title: Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
text: Converts depth strata standardized station suffixes consistent station ID creation.

title: Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
text: depth_strata Character vector depth strata stratify()

title: Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
text: Character vector station suffixes

title: Get Station Suffix from Depth Strata — station_suffix
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic usage depths <- c(0, 3, 8, 15, 25) strata <- stratify(depths) station_suffix(strata)  # Complete workflow survey_data$depth_strata <- stratify(survey_data$station_depth_m) survey_data$station_suffix <- station_suffix(survey_data$depth_strata) } # }

what: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
title: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
text: Converts depth measurements meters standardized Pristine Seas depth strata categories using fixed thresholds consistency across projects.

title: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
text: avg_depth_m Numeric vector. Average depth measurements meters

title: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
text: Character vector depth stratum labels: "surface", "supershallow", "shallow", "deep", NA

title: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
text: Standard Pristine Seas depth strata: Surface: exactly 0m Supershallow: 0.1 - 6m Shallow: 6.1 - 14m Deep: 14.1 - 30m NA: > 30m (beyond standard survey depths)

title: Stratify Depths into Standard Categories — stratify
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Stratify survey depths depths <- c(0, 3, 8, 12, 18, 25, 35) stratify(depths)  # Use with data frame survey_data$depth_stratum <- stratify(survey_data$avg_depth_m) } # }
